message+desc:
Don't think these rants are going to help your asylum bid Amos!

At this rate, I won't be surprised if it was rejected and you're sent back to Singapore to serve NS. :(Amos Yee has taken on a bigger enemy: US President Donald Trump.

He says Mr Trump's immigration crackdown is anti-free speech -- the same crackdown that's causing him to rot in jail for months. Good luck.

https://mustsharenews.com/amos-yee-trump/
comments:
Thank u very much but the US of A can keep Anus Yee. And the rate he is going, they will probably find his corpse in the cell one morning. US prison gangs mean business.$$He's going to be in prison limbo for a long time, with that attitude. I think he grossly overestimates how many people actually care about what he says or does.$$Haha 'it'  reminds me of the movie he is a beast! Anyway if  no countries take him in that means he has to come back.  Not sure if that is what we want? But like the old saying goes "grass is always greener in the other side" apparently doesn't seem so now.$$Questioning policies and identifying flaws within a government should not be chastised. In a democracy, a government should represent the views of the people. Not just the majority, but all people within the country need to be considered. Having an opinion and expressing it is therefore not a bad thing. Whilst i can appreciate that there may have been quite a few undiplomatic responses from him, it is unfair to say that he must be an expert if he wants to comment on international (and even intranational issues) issues because after all, the decisions made by the government affect everyone (even externally because foreign policy exists). So for a true democracy to work it must have the involvement of all its citizens, which does include him.
I.e having different views does not mean you deserve jail. Doing something illegal means that you serve a prison sentence with the intent of not reoffending upon release.$$sorry, dont come back. You are a disgrace for sg menfolk. Crazy buggers can slug it out with each other in the land of the free for all I care.$$People get exp through time. But he doesn't seem to learn anything. His max lvl cap at lvl 1?$$He didn't learn from HHH. Get citizenship then kpkb about each & everything. By then, its nearly impossible to revoke citizenship & send you back.$$Oh shit, Trump.did not accept him... Now shit is coming back...$$How come he hasn't already been sent back?
It's been how many months already ?$$I am waiting for it to seek for more trouble, soon no countries will take him in$$You all know dat he can choose to be deported elsewhere. Condition - provided the country he chose accepts him. A good indicator of asylum approval.$$Playing with the big boys now.  Sorry but I blame the indulgent mother and the adults who should know better than to feed into his pipe dreams$$You want free speech?go to IMH.inside you can shout any vulgarities at any government people yoi don't like.plus free food and logging if you don't have money.üòÄüòÄüòÄ$$Idiot verse fool, see which is which ?$$Let's hope he doesn't get BLACKED in the Chicago prison.$$Please stay there and don't ever come back to Sg.$$Please stop making stupid people famous.

Do you know "Fukubukuro" ?
One of the funnest New Year's shopping experiences in Japan, "Fukubukuro" or lucky bags.  
The idea behind Fukubukuro originates from a bag that God carries which is filled with luck. Fukubukuros are limited in number, but the assortment of items in the bags is always worth several times more than the price of the bag and they are mainly sold on January 2nd & 3rd throughout Japan.
Let's head out to buy a Fukubukuro and get lucky!
More Story > http://japan-magazine.jnto.go.jp/en/1411_luckybag.html
comments: Love fukubukuro!! Tegan Ilsley Erin Ilsley Nette Murray$$Bianca Piasini we need to buy these after new years!$$It is the one thing grant has learnt about. We will see Iif I can fit one in for youüòÅ$$My Japanese lover always fine the right and expensive choice every time of buying Fukubukoro ^^$$Finally. Something that happens on my birthday, Jan. 2! (Usually people are too broke after the holidays and too tired after New Year's to celebrate with me.)

message+desc:
Do you know three great gardens of Japan? 
The answer is "Kenrokuen Garden"(Ishikawa Pref.), "Korakuen Garden"(Okayama Pref.), and "Kairakuen Garden"(Ibaraki Pref.), which are well-known for their beautiful scenery. 
         
This picture is taken at Kenrokuen garden where you can see triangle-shaped trees called Yukizuri which is a technique for preserving trees from heavy snowfalls. It can be seen around the areas that have heavy snow in winter. Kenrokuen garden is also a popular spot of Yukizuri, and will start illuminated from Feb. 3rd. It is definitely worth visiting!!
 
For more information: http://hot-ishikawa.jp/f-lang/pdf/2011winter/2011winter_en_14.pdf
Ishikawa Prefecture Tourism Guide: http://hot-ishikawa.jp/f-lang/english/

Cheers, from Indonesia www.liburanmurah.info$$that most beautiful scenery, every photo that comes out here the more I love Japan a luxury$$I love this place. It is so beautiful in winter. message+desc:
The photo of the day is of coral reef in Okinawa. The sea in Okinawa is ideal for coral because of the clear water and warmth from the Kuroshio Ocean Current. Okinawa's sea attracts many divers because of the beautiful fishes that can be seen as they swim around the colorful coral reef.
More details: http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/attractions/rest/sports/surfing_4.html
Photo courtesy: Klaus Stiefel & Piranha Divers Okinawa
